Gabonese President Supports Korean People's Struggle 
   Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- Gabonese President El Hadj Omar Bongo Ondimba, when receiving credentials from the Korean ambassador to Gabon on May 29, remembered those days of his visit to the DPRK and expressed his deep respect for President  Kim Il Sung who had sincerely helped African countries including Gabon.
 He extended firm solidarity to the fraternal Korean people in building a great prosperous powerful socialist nation, united as one in mind around leader Kim Jong Il, and said that it is the stand of the Gabonese government to value and steadily develop the friendly and cooperative relations with Korea.    
 He expressed absolute support to the Korean people in their just struggle to achieve the reunification of the country independently and peacefully without foreign interference.

articles.content:
Formation of Investigation Committee Demanded in S. Korea 
   Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- The Measure Committee for Unveiling Truth about the Rogun-ri Massacre in south Korea demanded the formation of an investigation committee in the United Nations for probing into the truth behind the massacres of civilians. This demand was made in its statement regarding the disclosure of another data on the brutal killing of civilians by GIs, according to south Korean radio CBS on May 31.
 The U.S. Congress should open a hearing on the massacre of civilians in Rogun-ri, south Korea, and institute a special law to settle the case and the U.S. government should admit its responsibility and pay compensations to the victims, urged the statement.

articles.content:
Algerian Ambassador Presents Credentials to Kim Yong Nam 
   Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, received credentials from Djamel Eddine Grine, Algerian ambassador to the DPRK, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Thursday.
 On hand were Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Kung Sok Ung and an official of the Algerian embassy.    
 Kim Yong Nam had a talk with the ambassador after receiving his credentials.

articles.content:
Congratulations to Thai King 
   Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, sent a congratulatory message to Thai King Bhumibol Adulyadej today on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of his accession to the throne.
 In the belief that the ties of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would grow stronger, the message sincerely wished the king good health and happiness as well as the people of Thailand happiness and prosperity.

articles.title: DPRK Delegation Leaves for Cuba
articles.content:
Congratulations to Algerian Prime Minister 
   Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- Pak Pong Ju, Premier of the DPRK Cabinet, sent a congratulatory message to Abdelaziz Belkhadem Tuesday on his appointment as prime minister of Algeria.
 Expressing the belief that the long-standing relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would grow stronger in the future, the message wholeheartedly wished him success in his responsible work for the prosperity of the country.

DPRK Delegation Leaves for Cuba 
   Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Korea-Cuba Solidarity Committee led by Kim Yong Jin, minister of Education who is chairman of the solidarity committee, Thursday left here for Cuba.
 It was seen off at the airport by Jon Hyon Chan, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries and vice-chairman of the solidarity committee, and Ruben Perez Valdes, Cuban ambassador to the DPRK.

Delegation of International Affairs Institute Leaves for China 
   Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the International Affairs Institute led by Vice-Director Jang Yun Gon left here Thursday to visit China.
 It was seen off at Pyongyang Railway Station by Vice-Director of the Institute Ri Yong Thae and Wu Shumin, minister councilor of the Chinese embassy here.
